column6:
I have NO IDEA why other reviewers are deeming these "unwearable" after 1-2 wears. What are you doing while wearing them?!
I've owned these since December. I wear them for hanging out sometimes (because they're SO comfy), but I also put them to work -- lots of high intensity indoor cycling. I sweat heavily, and surprisingly they do a nice job of keeping that relatively hidden. And they've held up incredibly well so far. I wear them probably once a week and washed them at least half a dozen times already. Despite the fact that these are high rise, and they do have to stretch a lot to get them over my bigger bum and hip bones, they still fit the way they did when I bought them. Once they're on, they're on. No real stretching at all yet even after a few months. Don't trust the reviewers who say these pants stretch like crazy!!
I have these leggings in black, size 6. I am 5'9, 130 lbs, 27 in waist. Bought in store so I know they're the correct fit/size. They're double layered, so transparency is not an issue. I love these leggings. I want more colors!

column5: All-Time Fav Leggings but thread snapped!!!
column6: These pants fit so perfectly, probably my favourite pair of lulus ever. Ordered them online, and they were amazing. I had no problems at all. But then the first time I (very gently) took them off, the string in the waistband had zero elasticity and snapped. Sure my butt is a lil big but that shouldn't happen so easily. Now it just dangles loosely. I still love the leggings and I know the size is right but the waist needs an elastic instead of a thin, breakable string. I would give them a 5/5 if it weren't for that!

I need to wash them hot and put them in the dryer in order to be able to wear them, and even then they don't have the same tight fit they did in store. column5: Really wanted to love but stretches out!
column6: Okay, so let me preface by saying I have 7 pairs of align pants. They've been my favorite since they first came out so when these came out, I was actually intrigued in stepping out of my align pant obsession to try these out. The stitching absolutely drew me to the pants, as well as the extremely soft fabric. SO I bit the bullet and bought my first pair of lulus for as long as I can remember that weren't aligns. After the first wear, I noticed the intricate stitching on my left leg was stretched out and made a weird bump. It no longer lay flat against my skin as tights normally should and it bugged me. I shrugged it off, and told myself I was being too critical of them. However, the more I wore them, the more I started to see more and more of that stretched out stitching. I put them on again just now to go to the gym annnnnd I just couldn't take it anymore. Lulu, I love you to death, and I really love the concept of these pants, but please do something about the stretched out stitching!! Love, a devoted lululemon lover.

column6: The everlux material feels like a combo of nulux and luxtreme, I absolutely love them! You get the buttery soft feel of the nulux but the compression of the luxtreme. I wore these to climb indoors and hot yoga and they stayed in place and dried immediately. My only complaint is that they do feel a little big by my ankles. Wish lulu would make more colors of this material (maybe the bonfire color please!).

I have these in both the black and dark purple (aeon?). They have quickly become some of my favorite leggings for the gym. The everlux material is cool inside and I like how the exterior feels more like luon than luxtreme. They are totally squat proof on me. I've worn them for weightlifting, spin class, and general cardio, and they've worked well for each. I love that they don't have the zippered pockets like a lot of the running pants because the waistband doesn't dig in while doing floorwork. The length is perfect on me - they hit right above the ankles with no bunching or extra material (I'm 5'4.5"). I've worn and washed each pair about 3-4 times each and have had no issues with the seams or the leggings stretching out. I hope these become a core item!

I purchased these leggings due to the align pant I ordered weeks prior not being delivered. I was fine settling with these but when I received the leggings the stitching was already unraveling in 3 separate places and I hadn't even tried them on!! Never a great feeling when you spend the money and the product is already worn and torn before wearing:/

column6: I'm a huge wunder under legging addict so when these came out I wasn't sure if I'd like them. I went and tried them on since they came in so many unique colors. The compression is perfect and the back pocket is FINALLY big enough for my iPhone. The high rise is great and they are comfortable and do not slip when doing yoga.I'm 5 6 and they go just to the bottom of my ankles which is great as I was having to hem all my wunder unders. HOWEVER, I did have to take the first pair back to my local lulu to redo the stitching so I'd buy in store if possible since it seems like the stitching on these particular leggings is inconsistent (my second pair had no issues). The fabric is breathable but sturdy.

These pants are super sleek and loved the fit as soon as I tried them on... however after a day of wearing them I found myself having to constantly pull them up. column5: soft like align but not as delicate!
column6:
These tights are really soft, but do catch lint easily (my lint roller is my BFF when I wear them). As long as you don't sit on a fleece blanket etc.. your day to day use shouldn't pick up too much lint. They have a slimming effect on the legs and the stitching on the calves is so pretty. Only problem is that they are higher waisted and can become a tad uncomfortable after many hours of continuous wear. All of my other tights have pockets so it took some getting used to.
Great quality, the material is way thicker than the Aligns but still have a great soft feel.

I ordered these leggings online as they unfortunately didn't have them in store. I was so excited for these legging to arrive but after only 4 wears the waist has completely stretched out , the seems in the waist have started to fall apart and the bottom ankle seem came to me already tattered. I ignored the fact that they came to me a little tattered because i was excited to finally have them but i do not recommend these leggings at all, very disappointed.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi shanleigh,\nI’d love to lend a hand with some solutions so I’ve sent you an email that outlines the next steps—chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'January 22, 2018'}

column6: Had this leggings for a month, only wore them casually (for errands/hanging out/light hiking), and the stitching has started to unravel in numerous places. Very disappointed with the quality of these given the high price point.

These pants, no matter what, always end up baggy and having to be continuously
pulled up... fabric feels great but otherwise- skip these

column5: Love the look, hate the quality.
column6:
Do NOT buy these pants! I wish I would have read the reviews before ordering.
I wore them once, washed them (delicate, hang dry) and the seams are falling apart. I'm super disappointed in the quality. I have 7 year old wunder unders that are in better shape than these.
Please do something about your fabric because this is embarrassing.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey tristalh,\nThis definitely doesn't sound right. We stand behind the quality of our gear and would love to know more about your experience with this. Keep your eye out, an email is on its way.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 18, 2018'}

column6:
I bought these leggings initially because they were the most comfortable thing I've ever put on my body....then I bought two more pairs. Yes, the material does collect dust and lint easily, but I am willing to take that trade-off for the luxury of the Everlux material. They do stretch a tiny bit, but I've found they snap right back after proper washing. I've only had them for a couple weeks now, but I haven't taken them off yet!
I've used them for training and yoga mostly.
Will keep updated on if they grow worse over time, but at the moment, they're amazing. Would recommend!

I find this style of pants are very flattering, form fitting but a little looser than luxtreme tights. I recommend sizing down one size. I originally ordered a size 4 but than returned them for a 2- much better! Super comfortable:).

I noticed that a lot of people continue to say things about the pilling. So far I have warn my pants about 10 times and each time to wash them I turn them inside out. Always letting them hang dry as well. No pilling yet! They even bounce back from a little stretching out. They slightly loosen a bit but nothing crazy. I wouldn't run in these due to them not having a draw string, I find even the wonder under slip a bit. Both more for strength or yoga, everyday even , but not running, not the most breathable.

column5: Love the Look, Hate the Lint
column6: These leggings are beautiful. I asked for the dark blue/teal color for christmas and love the way they fit/look. Except...for the insane amount of lint these attract. I find myself constantly picking things off of them, unlike all of my other lulu pants. I wish I could love these but I just can't. Sad that this is what I asked for and they are so covered in lint I can't even leave the house! I would not recommend these.

I got these and was super excited for them but after wearing them for 2 workouts it seems the seams of the pants don't feel too sturdy. The side seam has already started to come undone, I'm nervous that if I wear these again the seam will just completely unravel. Also after wearing them for a while I find I am constantly pulling them up which is stretching the waistband out a bit. The 25" length works out great for me though, being so petite and are full length pants on me which is great for my not flooding at my ankles.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey runningeverywhere,\nThanks so much for taking the time to get in touch today and share your thoughts. I definitely hear your disappointment and would love to help. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'January 15, 2018'}

column6: I was hesitant to buy these pants after reading some the reviews, but I liked them so much on I decided to go ahead and purchase. I wanted a legging that was more compressed than the Align, but not as tight fitting as some of the luxtreme leggings, i.e. the Train TImes pant. Overall, I think these pants fit that bill and are a pretty good, versatile legging. The material is both soft and compressing, almost a blend of nulu and luxtreme. I've worn them to strength train, with leggings and boots, and to travel. I haven't noticed some of the seaming issues that others have mentioned and there's been no pilling. I've washed them probably 4 times now. I did size down from my normal 6 to a 4 in these pants, like I do for Align.

Bought these last week, wore them shopping for the first time on Sunday, and within 2 hours of wearing them the seams/stitching at the top waist band have popped.
I am so sad. These are the very first pair of Lulu tights I have bought. I spent a good 35 mins trying on many different styles.
These feel gorgeous and are the most beautiful deep teal colour.

column6: I got a pair of these for Christmas and I love them so much I'm ordering a second pair in a different color. Not see through and show no sweat. They are high-rise and are the perfect length, and I am 5'9''. They keep you cool whether training or running. Definitely recommend!

Absolutely fell in love with these in the store! Wore them once all day and had no issues. Washed once with all my other leggings, let air dry. Second time I put them on, everything was loose as a goose. I couldn't walk without having to pull them up every few steps.
Loved the look and the stitching detail, but proceed with caution if you don't like things getting loose!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey LawyerLeggingLover,\nThis definitely doesn't sound right. We stand behind the quality of our gear and would love to know more about your experience with this. Keep your eye out, an email is on its way.", 'LL_response_date': 'January 12, 2018'}

column6:
I LOVE these leggings! They were recommended to me in store and I'm so glad I tried them. They are very soft yet very strong with a "hugged" fit that makes you feel secure but not uncomfortably tight.
In the store the sales lady told me that they are one of the few leggings that are meant for all activities from yoga to cardio to weightlifting, all of which I do and can attest to. If you like the Align II leggings, these feel like the stronger older sister that is actually made for intensity.
Cons: (1) Lint is easily attracted to these pants, but that personally doesn't bother me. (2) The waistband might be a smidgen too tight, but I have grown to appreciate it as it makes me feel secure when I run.
In jeans I am between sizes 4-6 and went with a 4 in these leggings so they had no chance of riding down.

column5: I could live in these pants!
column6: I am in love with these pants and the Everlux fabric. I have three 7/8 pair and one crop pair. I also have the Train Times 7/8 pants and I prefer the In Movement pants. I work out 6 days a week doing strength training and Crossfit WODs. The In Movement pants are comfortable during every workout; no pulling, tugging them up, just a soft, next to skin feel. These are also the only pants that when I leave the gym I could leave them on the rest of the day because they are so comfortable. Most other pants I change out of as soon as I get home because I'm tired of the squeeze. I am very happy with the quality of my pants, no piling or damage and I've been wearing for about 6 months. Please Lululemon, make as many products as you can in the Everlux fabric! And keep adding new colors, possibly prints, for the In Movement pant. I will gladly pay $98 to keep buying such an awesome pant!

I bought these leggings because they were recommended to me by an associate at a store. I found the align ones I had could only be used for gentle yoga classes, because they pilled easily. I was informed that this would not pill, and could be used for running or yoga. I only wore my pants twice, and the seam is opened. It’s very disappointing to pay such a hefty amount, use it for gentle yoga twice and have the seams parting ways already. I now have align pants that pilled after a few uses, and this pant that has torn seams. I seem to be out over $200 plus tax (combined for both). I love Lululemon but just can’t recommend these pants to anyone.

Now the fabric is pulling away from the seams in the butt, where you can see skin! I have had them several months, but don't wear them often, and have never even worked out in them. If I am going to spend $100 on pants, I want them to last me a long time without falling apart.

She was continually pulling them up to stay in place. This is the first pair of pants that we have bought so we don't have any comparisons however we are very disappointed with this product so far.

I really liked the leggings at first, the fit was nice, however after one workout they became baggy and i noticed that lint was sticking to them like crazy. I got a size 6 because the size 4 was a bit too tight when I tried them on in store. Maybe I should have sized down. And after one wash (I wash all my Lululemons by hand and let them air dry) I noticed that the lint and hair began to stick to them even more and they are not as fitted as they were in store. Overall I was expecting more from these leggings.

column6: I was obsessed with these the first time I tried them on. They were so comfortable and perfect for any workout. However, after just a few weeks, they have completely stretched out, especially in the waist. Now, I have to constantly pull them up while running. It's so disappointing because they were some of my favorites at the start.

column6:
I LOVE THESE. After living life in $20 Amazon leggings for so long, these are life changing. I'm ready to buy them in every color.
Pros: they fit like a glove! They're described as a hugged sensation legging, which is true. They're not quite the compression of the Wunder Unders but they keep everything in place without feeling like I'm falling out of them (e.g. Gymshark flex leggings). I have washed and worn these several times a week for over a month and there's no pilling, no seam wear, they retain shape perfectly. They also don't show sweat and are soooooo, so comfortable.
Cons: I don't own enough pairs to wear them daily. Also, I wish more lulu leggings came in this particular fabric. It's the best.

I bought the in movement tight because I love the way they felt and the way they were designed. A big problem I have been having with a few pairs of Lululemon leggings I have gotten in the last few months have been that they stretch after only a few times wearing them. They will fit like a dream in store, but after 2 or 3 wears the fabric on the butt, ankles, and even the waist band started to loosen and sag, which is not flattering at all. I was extra disappointed because I specifically asked about my concern of sagging and were assured these pants would maintain they're shape and structure. Overall I would not recommend these tights.

column6: I wanted a pair of leggings for yoga, and light training sessions. I was told the Align pant tends to pill near the inner thigh region so I opted for these because they just felt heavenly when on. I was excited to try them out to a Mat Pilates class, and I regretted that decision within minutes of starting. The high waist is higher than my other high-waist leggings, and it literally made it to where I had to constantly unfold the top. It drove me nuts to say the least. Pilates and Yoga were out. So, since they are so comfortable I decided to wear them around the house and to run errands in today. Its now night time and the past couple hours I kept having to adjust and pull them up near the knee area so they wouldn't slide down. These fit like second-skin when I got them, but although they are fitted still, they have stretched more than appropriate. Again, almost there, but a miss for me.

column5: Started out perfect.. then stretched out after one workout/wash
column6: I got the In Movement leggings for Christmas and I was so excited because, (1) I didn't ask for them and (2) I tried them on a few weeks prior and I loved them however Christmas was coming up and I didn't need to spend the money. When I tried them on, they fit perfectly and the material was so soft, I was in love. Anyways, I wore them for my first workout back after Christmas, a sports styled workout, and they were great! My only complaint was that the turf I was training on was sticking to the material like crazy and then I noticed a lot of dust and debris would stick to them as well. After I washed them once, I put them on to run errands and to my surprise they stretched out a lot! This has never happened to any of my leggings from Lulu and I have 10+ pairs. They kept falling down so much, it was super annoying. So as these leggings might seem like a good idea at the point of purchase, the quality unfortunately declines almost immediately. I am extremely disappointed as I've always stood behind Lulu's products because I believe the quality is worth the price, however this pair did not meet my expectations.

column6: When I first bought these pants, everything was going smoothly: the fabric was soft and beautiful, the fit was snug but not too tight, and I was able to dance freely. Unfortunately, it was not long before the pants started to become very loose, to the point where I wouldn't even be able to dance in them because they would keep moving down. It was also not long before I realized that the smooth fabric I once loved tends to attract literally every single dust particle and quickly accumulated a layer that I would have to remove with a lint roller multiple times a day. I put my trust in lululemon once again but in the end, these pants simply just made it harder for me to get through the day.

column6: I got these as a Christmas gift as my first pair of lululemon leggings. When I first put them on, they felt amazing - super soft and great fit. However after only one wear, the seams are fraying! I haven't even washed them or worn them for more than 3 hours. For the price, I can't believe how low quality they are.

We would love to get a better understanding why you may be experiencing this. We have sent you an email to have a further chat.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 30, 2017'}

column6:
I'm divided on these ones - I was initially intrigued because of how good they looked on a store employee - she gushed about how they wouldn't pill because they were made with a combination of the Luxtreme and Luon material - a new material called Everlux. I tried them on and was blown away by the fit and feel, but they also pill over time and the fabric catches lint like no other.
Three pairs later, here are my thoughts about them.
THE GOOD:
- VERY comfortable.
- Very little stretching out - you can wear these for days and they'll feel like new every time.
- Flattering fit and high rise hugs just enough.
- Great for lifting, running, you name it - they'll stay up and work with you.
THE BAD:
- I know I just said the high rise is good but these have nothing on the compression of the Fast & Frees or Wunder Unders. I feel like with the Wunder Under my tummy pouch just disappears. Not the case with the In Movements, they definitely show a little tummy, not a bad thing but doesn't feel as secure.
- They pill pretty much immediately. I took them on a walk around the city and came home with pilling on the inside of my thighs. Minimal usage - quick pilling.
- The WORST thing about these is that they catch onto ANY LINT in your closet/whatever you sit on when you go out. They end up looking a little old and fuzzy because of this. I recommend storing them inside out so that they don't collect dust over time.
- When I workout in these my legs get HOT. There's no breathability whatsoever.
So in conclusion I think I just got really over hyped by how they felt and jumped the gun on buying a third pair. I bought two initially in my excitement but I think overall I would stick to buying something else in the future. They're definitely very comfortable but they don't feel like they will last and the flattering fit doesn't look so flattering when there's all this lint on my leg. I'll wear out what I have for now but the cons outweigh the pros for me right now.
If you're looking to buy and want to know the right size, I am 5'2" and I normally wear a size 12. I bought these in a 12 and they were TTS.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey jinxx,\nThanks for connecting with us. I'm sorry to hear your gear started pilling so quickly. Keep an eye out for an email with some solutions headed your way.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 29, 2017'}

column6: I am relatively new to LLL. I own three pairs of LLL leggings - Align II, Fast and Frees, and another pair that I want to say are called Final Lap? Anyway, I LOVE them all. I never wanted to spend the money on LLL pants, but I do not regret my purchases. HOWEVER, I bought these In Movement tights the other day, and I am not happy. I thankfully have the tag still on, and will be returning. I tried them on today - I didn't at the store because I always wear a 6 - and they are so just uncomfortably tight. I wear a 6 in all of my other LLL tights. These are WAY too tight, I am honestly just mad. I would size up, but then so many people are saying they are having issues with them stretching out. So, I think I may just take them back to get some Aligns. So disappointing, I wanted to love these.

I can never work out in these. As soon as you start to workout, they start to fall down. They fit me tight in the store and when I first put them on. However, after awhile I am pulling them up constantly.
column11: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.

We stand behind the quality of our gear and want to make sure it's performing well for you. We'll be in touch via email to follow up and help.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 28, 2017'}

column6: I had high expectation for these pants as Lulu does not usually let me down .... However, after wearing these pants 3 times, the seams have already begun to tear. I know that it has nothing to do with my care of the legging as I have treated them the same as any other Lulu product that I own (hang to dry). I'm not one to write bad reviews ever, but I was significantly shocked by the products' poor quality. I have been purchasing from Lulu for the past 6 years and I have never had a legging tear like this one has.

column6:
I have had those pants on for about 15 minutes and yet, the seems are already starting to get undone. I was very disappointed as i have owned three pairs of wonder under and even my older ones (5 years) are still intact. Too bad the price tag was even higher...
Scared to order lulu now
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Marguerite,\nThanks for connecting with us. I'm so sorry to hear your In Movement 7/8 Tight isn't holding up. We stand by the quality of our gear and want to make sure it's performing well for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 27, 2017'}

column6: I have been a loyal Lulu customer for years now, and I have never had an issue with their leggings until this year. I have many pairs of Wunder Unders, and they are absolutely my favorite leggings! However, I bought these leggings around thanksgiving, and the seams are unraveling. It seems like the quality of these are less than the wunder unders, which is a bummer because of the price tag. I'm very let down by these leggings, they can't even stand up to my light workouts (mainly yoga) and normal washing (delicate cycle, no fabric softener, cold water, hang dry) without coming apart. Very disappointed.

column6: I just got this pair for Christmas. Wore them for a day and the seams have already frayed at the hips. I always wear a size 4 in lulu, so I dont think it is because they are too small. They actually felt very confortable and very light. However, you can get other leggings that are as comfortable but way better quality.

Since it sounds like this isn't the case, please keep an eye on your inbox so we can get to work on a solution for you.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 26, 2017'}

column6:
Here's what I like about these: really soft material, wick sweat very well, very flattering lines on these tights
Here's what I don't like: the seam started coming apart on the inside of the pants after one wash...so that stinks.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey bcaliflor,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 26, 2017'}

column6: I bought these pants and a pair of Wunder Under pants on the same day. I absolutely love the Wunder Under pants and wear them often. But these pants are terrible quality. After washing them only two times (only with other Lulu pants and never in the dryer), the seams have frayed and they attract lint like crazy. They look worse than Lulu pants that I have had for several years. I am very disappointed with the low quality of these pants.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi LuluLemonLover18,\nI’d love to lend a hand with some solutions so I’ve sent you an email that outlines the next steps—chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'December 23, 2017'}

column6:
I love the fit and feel of these pants! They have just the right amount of compression, but are also super soft! Similar to the Align pant, but I find these to be much more comfortable. I've seen the reviews about the stitching, I personally haven't had any issues with it on my pants though. I always wash with similar materials, delicate cycle, and refrain from any zippers in the wash with them that could cause pulling , and haven't noticed any problems.
They are perfect for the gym (no sheerness when you bend over or move around), or even for everyday. Fit true to size.

I discovered the inmovement leggings and switched from buying the aligns to buying the inmovement for working out and the aligns for lounging and running errands. When I first discovered them I was in heaven! So ecstatic. They feel like they are hugging you and give full coverage to be squat proof which is never easy. I was telling all of my friends to buy them (now I need to tell them to try another legging)...I'm so sad to see that a pair of my purple leggings are now falling apart with the stitching unraveling in the back seam after only 1 use. A few of my other ones are unraveling in the inside upper waist as well. I want to love these pants but for over $100 a pair they should be much better quality. I'm so sad.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Maleeka,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. I'm so sorry that you're experiencing seam issues. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!", 'LL_response_date': 'December 21, 2017'}

column6: I just ordered these three weeks ago, wore for one workout. Feel great, look great (they seem a little bigger than others) but after 1 wash (I never put my workout pants in the dryer so they dried on the rack) wore them today and there were at least 5 pulls of string on the seams, 3 by the crotch, 2 on the legs. I'm not sure as I've never had this experience with a Lulu pant after one wear. Not sure what to do but for 98 bucks I feel they may not hold up. I pulled the strings as I was at the gym without scissors, we'll see.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Tillyat,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 19, 2017'}

column5: Love these BUT seams coming undone
column6: I love everything about these - the fit is perfect, they are super comfortable, and they wick very very well. BUT the seams are starting to come undone after only a couple of wears and very careful washing. They also seem to attract lint so they look much more worn than they actually are. Very disappointing...!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey LuluLuvr410,\nWe\'re sorry to hear you\'re experiencing unraveling seams with your In Movement 7/8 Tight *Everlux 25". We would love to get a better understanding why you may be experiencing this. We have sent you an email to have a further chat.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 19, 2017'}

column6: I like these for Crossfit, I haven’t run in them yet. I usually buy a size 6 in the “Fast and Free” and “Wunder Under” but got a size 4 for the “In Movement” 7/8 tight. The crop fit tighter and the waist seemed lower, didn’t feel like the same fit. I actually bought this in 3 colors, I’ve worn 2 of them so far and happy with the way the wear and wash. I agree with other reviewers that lint seems to stick to this fabric but not that big of a problem for Crossfit. For reference, I’m 5’6” and about 140 lbs, definitely recommend sizing down, I tried a size 6 first and they immediately began sliding down. Also noticed that some of the colors fit differently, the black, navy, and black currant fit great but the waist in the black cherry was sewn super tight and I couldn’t get it over my hips. Overall, I think these are great for the gym.
column11: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.

column5: Great material but seams coming undone after ONE wear
column6: I bought these on the way to teach a special class. I LOVED the feel...but after one wear they are coming apart at the waistband. I really wanted to like these...and not sure what to do as I already ripped the tag off and wore them.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey StudioOwner,\nWe hear your disappointment and will be sending an email your way to follow up and lend a helping hand.\nSpeak soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 18, 2017'}

column6: I had heard not so great things about the Align pants holding up and bought a pair of these instead in Nocturnal Teal. So far, I am loving them! The fabric feels smooth and durable, the seams are flattering, and the colour is beautiful. I wear them for going to the gym (weight lifting mainly) and have not had any issues with seams fraying or the leggings bagging out. I did size down from my usual 6 to a 4 and the fit has stayed very form-fitting. I would love to get another pair of these in black :)

I absolutely love these tights for weight training. I have yet to use them for running. They are super flattering and make my butt look great. I pair them with my Box It Out crop tanks and the cropped look with these leggings makes my legs look really long. I also love the colour choices - I got the Garnet and looking to get a couple more colours in the New Year. The only negative thing about these leggings and why I didn't get them a 5/5 is because the stitching around the waist is sewn pretty tight, that I have to be really careful when putting them on and taking them off. No rips or stretching after two months of wear, so here's hoping!
column15: stitching is sewn very tight at waist

column6:
LOVE the material and shape of these pants. I use the 7/8s as pants because I'm short, and the full pants seem to be too big around the ankles, even when I get them hemmed. I downsized to a 4 because I seem to be perfectly between a 4 and 6.
Despite how much I love the feel, the stitching on these is terrible. They look ruined on the seem after a few washes. I saw other reviews about this problem as well and decided to ignore them. Amazing fit, but wish the seems stayed how they were!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey hoosierdaddy7,\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback. We would love to get a bit more information on your experience, and look into some options. An email is headed your way, so keep an eye out.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 15, 2017'}

column6: When I first bought these pants I thought I had found "the one." The seaming is perfect, the high rise is amazing and the fabric is super soft. I loved them so much I bought more! However, I am super disappointed! I had not even had the leggings for a month. The second time I wore the pants I noticed that I had some seams fraying! The seam at the top of the waistband as well as the seam down the leg in two places. I knew this was uncommon so I brought them to my local lululemon to get this resolved. The store no longer had the color that I had purchased, they had apparently gone on sale and they were sold out online. The manager refused to swap them out for me and it was not something their taylor could fix. Now I have a pair of leggings that I can no longer wear without fear of them coming unraveled. Like I said, I originally loved the pants and planned on getting more pairs and telling everyone about them, but now I am not so sure. Lululemon help me out!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey SouthernBelle18,\nSorry to hear that your In Movement 7/8 Tight *Everlux 25" isn\'t holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 15, 2017'}

column6:
I bought these because of the cool stitching – too cute! The fabric is interesting... I like it a lot. It's super soft and cool to the touch. It feels so nice to wear them, I wish I could wear them all day every day! It does attract lint like no other though! I don't really like wearing them for high intensity workouts, but they're great for a lifting day or yoga.
I was going to buy another pair, but the seam along the inside of the waistband is starting to come out in more than one place. I care for my workout clothes well because I want them to last long, so I'm not sure what's going on with that!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi pnwskier,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!', 'LL_response_date': 'December 15, 2017'}

column5: Not the quality I expected, but otherwise nice
column6: So I was really excited because these were my first pair of lulus I have purchased! When trying them on in the store they were snug which is perfect for working out for me so I'm not pulling them up all the time, but also so comfortable! My main issue is that within one day's wear, the seam in the back is pulling apart and fraying. Just not the quality I expected for the price and slightly disappointed. Other than that, I really like these leggings.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi heyitscarl ,\nI’d love to lend a hand with some solutions so I’ve sent you an email that outlines the next steps. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'December 14, 2017'}

column5: Way to Slippery to even wear
column6: I am a Lulu Lover through and through and was thrilled when these went on sale because I had been eyeing them for a month! I have several Tights and these do not do what they claim.I'll make this short and sweet, the pattern is stunning, when you try them on in the store they sell themselves because of how good they feel. The negatives? They are not functional for ANY type of activity! I have now worn them 4 times first to a power vinyasa class in which I spent the entire class pulling them up as the fabric is so slippery, next to a crossfit class where I wasn't doing an excessive amount of cardio but again spent most of the class pulling these up. I'm really disappointed as I want to love them and because they're final sale will only be able to wear them to run errands with ought them falling down (not what I intended to purchase them for). At $79 ON SALE I would expect alot more from this legging. I wouldn't pay $39 if I had known their lack of performance prior to purchase :(

I bought these pants around 3 months ago and have been wearing them regularly to my work outs. I just put them on again to head to a late afternoon class and thought to myself "I REALLY love these pants...I need to get more of them" so I thought I would write a review! They fit great, they hold up great. I wear them to hot yoga at least once a week if not twice I will wear them! They are comfortable and dry quickly. I am definitely going to be purchasing more of these ASAP!

I bought these leggings a little over a week ago and I loved them at first, they fit perfectly. However I haven't even washed them yet and the seam is already ripping. I was very disappointed when I saw the ripped because I loved these at first. Definitely disappointed.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Kait,\nOh dear, I'm sorry to hear your seams have begun unravelling. I'll be reaching out shortly to work on a solution with you—keep an eye on your inbox!", 'LL_response_date': 'December 13, 2017'}

column6: I wear these pants once and they already pulled at the seams. I had a big climbing competition and I was so excited I went to get new tights. I ran five minutes before the camp comp to go buy them to have them as my “sending pants“. The day after I was going to dancing so I put on the pants only to find that the seam at the butt in the crotch fraying and pulling. I have always worn this size so I know it’s not from me being to big for the tights. I have only worn these pants for three hours and already they’re falling apart I’ve never been so disappointed by Lululemon and there quality.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi 4TheSendWildAndFree,\nThanks for taking the time to share your experience with us—we always want to ensure that our gear is performing for you as intended, and will be sending you an email so we can chat further and help you out!', 'LL_response_date': 'December 11, 2017'}

column6:
I recently bought these leggings and loved them! Like always, they came in just a couple days, they fit & felt great and looked awesome too! I especially love the material they're made from, the high rise, and the stitching is very flattering. Overall great pants, but this didn't last long!
I have many pairs of older lululemon leggings that have lasted for years and still look good- but after wearing these a handful of times, I washed them (by hand!) and put them in the dryer for less than 10 minutes on a gentle tumble dry. The stitching on the inside at the waist completely unravelled! I am not sure I can wear them again in fear that the stitching will just completely fall out! I was very disappointed as I thought that I was being sufficiently careful so that these expensive pants that I loved would last a long time, as my others have!
Overall, they are great pants that fit well and feel lovely, BUT you have to be so careful with them so that they don't fall apart like mine did! Very upset!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey molv,\nThanks for connecting with us. I'm sorry to hear the seam along the waist has unravelled—I can definitely understand your disappointment. We stand behind the quality of our gear and want to make this right. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 11, 2017'}

column6: UGH these leggings not only feel amazing on the skin, but look so good on the body too. There is just a couple downs to them. The attract any and all lint / hair, which is fine i just have to lint roll frequently. The thing that really bummed me out was the seams started to come out after one wash!! Im an avid lulu buyer so i do wash my attire properly. I went to the closest store near me which is an hour and a half away, the employee sent them off to get tailored, but i was VERY disappointed when they told me they couldn't ship them back to me when i told him how far i lived away from the closet lulu store.. Not only did these pants cost me $98 and the seams were coming out after one wash now i have to drive another hour and a half back in three days because he told me they couldn't ship. Ive never had a problem with having them ship the tailored items to my house :(

I loved these when I tried them on in store... They didnt feel as tight as the lulu pants I usually like, but they were super comfy and "hugged" so i went for it. After 40mins of wearing them, they felt loose and not the way I like my workout pants to feel, especially new ones. Ive never had to size down in Lulu pants before (im a solid 4) and reading some of the other reviews, they might be see through if I were to.
column15: did not retain any sort of tightness

column5: Beautiful pants but it was a let down
column6: I tried these pants on in store (size 2) and they fit perfectly, nice and snug. It wasn't difficult to get into. They were very flattering at the time and passed the squat test for me. I purchased them and wore them to train the same day. My training consisted of steady state cardio, a full upper body work out and an ab workout, nothing that would have the pants stretching too much. However, I'm very disappointed that after one wear and no wash, the waistband has already become so loose and by the end of the work out I had to keep pulling my pants up. The back pocket also stretch out after leaving my phone in there. I was excited about these but taking into account of how expensive they are and only after one wear, I'm not really impressed. The claim of it retaining its shape is simply not true.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey geestar,\nYikes. This doesn't sound good. We stand behind the quality of our gear and would love to know more about your experience with this. Keep your eye out, an email is on its way.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 9, 2017'}

column6: I bought these after I had tried on a different color in store and loved the fit and feel of the fabric. However, when I got these in the mail I tried them on and my husband quickly pointed out they were see through in the behind! I have many many pairs of lulu pants but this is the first pair of Everlux pants I have purchased. I am really disappointed in these pants and wish I could wear them to workout :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey LittleRockLuluLover,\nYikes. This doesn't sound good. We stand behind the quality of our gear and would love to know more about your experience with this. Keep your eye out, an email is on its way.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 9, 2017'}

column6:
I tried these leggings on in the store but didn't buy them that day. I went back a week later to buy them because I absolutely loved the way they fit and felt! I purchased the same size and color without trying them on again because I figured they would be the same fit as before. When I got home and put them on they felt a little more loose than I had remembered. After one wear they were bunchy in the crouch and knees and felt even more loose than when I had put them on that morning. These pants are meant to be hugging not hanging right?!
Just disappointed because I really do love the feel and look of the pants but won't be wearing them for working out which is why I purchased them in the first place.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey bailey14,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.', 'LL_response_date': 'December 7, 2017'}

column6: I purchased this pant because they are supposed to be versatile while maintaining the naked-esque feel. They're great for lounging and flowing, but I don't know that I would feel comfortable training in them. Lint catches easily, so grey would be the best color to purchase.

hi,

I absolutely love the way these leggings feel, the hi-rise, and the detail on them is great! What I didn't expect and what U don't like is that the material collects so much lint and I'm kinda embarrassed to wear them at work because of this. I really needed some black high rise leggings, but these aren't my favorite because of the lint. I recommend trying to fix the material somehow.

These pants were great until the third wear (without even washing them!). They have completely lost their shape in the knees and waist. Very baggy in many places. They don't pass the squat test either :( (embarrassing!). Overall, not impressed with Lulu. Wish they had the quality they used to offer because I don't want to shop anywhere else!
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi campuser,\nWe'd like to turn this around and ensure your gear is providing long-lasting performance for you. Since it sounds like this isn't the case, please keep an eye on your inbox so we can get to work on a solution for you.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 4, 2017'}

column5: Very comfortable but pilling on first wear
column6: I LOVE the way these pants fit and feel, probably the most comfortable pants I've ever purchased, however after ONE gym session they are already pilling and the seam is damaged. I haven't even washed them and my session consisted of abs and some cycling, which from my understanding is what they were made for! I'm not too pleased with how they held up considering how much I paid for them and at this rate they wont last very many wears.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi trainer96,\nWe’re sorry to hear that your pants aren't holding up as expected, we'd love to make this right. Please keep an eye on your inbox as we'll be connecting shortly to help turn this around.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 4, 2017'}

column6:
I was so looking forward to these! Especially the idea of slinky Everlux. The fabric itself feels like butter, which I love. Unfortunately, in practice, there's little to no compression, the fabric attracts lint like crazy, and I probably should have sized down.
In my usual size 4, the fabric feels tight at first but after wearing, I've found it pools around my knees and ankles. As a result, I spend time adjusting them during ballet and weight training. I don't have this issue with my full luxtreme styles- they stay put once I pull them on.
The waist doesn't hold me in- instead, it produces an odd lower belly pooch. As a sweat collective member: thumbs down on this design, I prefer more styles like the train times 7/8 legging which transition from yoga, barre, weights, cardio easily!

I never really review anything online unless I feel really strongly about the product (good/bad). I was actually really disappointed in the In Movement 7/8 Tight. I barely buy Lulu (2x a year) because I really don't have the disposable income for it, so when I buy a purchase I like to go in the store and make sure I feel good about it. I purchased the In Movement to wear to Orange Theory Classes - DO NOT BUY unless you're just want to look cute going to the grocery store. They constantly fall down and don't have an adjustable waist band to keep them up (For reference I am 5' 7' 138 - Athletic build with a smaller waist.). The sales people at my Lulu told me these would be great for the classes since they are quick drying. These pants feel super hot and are not comfortable at all for an Orange Theory workout. Now I am stuck with $98 leggings that I don't even want to wear. I love Lulu and will still shop- here but these leggings honestly do not deliver what they promised.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Blueberryalmond,\nThanks for taking the time to connect with us. I'm so sorry to hear your In Movement 7/8 Tight didn't retain its shape and stay up during your workout. I can understand how disappointed you are and would love to find a solution for you. Keep an eye out for an email headed your way so we can follow up and help.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 2, 2017'}

column5: Pilled and looked awful in no time
column6:
Purchased these a while ago and within 3 months all of the fabric and seams started pilling and somehow a hole started to form on the upper back/hip/waist area (in an area that had zero likelihood of having been caught on anything. The fabric basically disintegrates and looks terrible. The woman I spoke to tried to convince me that the pilling (which was even happening on the shins of the pants that likely hadn't contacted any other fabric) was from "sitting on a couch with a blanket" and that I should "purchase a de-piller" for 3-month old +$130 pants. So just beware, you can't sit on couches in these pants, or you risk them falling apart.
I've had multiple Luon-based products that I've never had problems with, but this fabric is cheap and not worth what you're paying.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey jrun3,\nWe hear your disappointment with the pilling you're experiencing on your gear and will be sending an email your way so we can dig into this with you.", 'LL_response_date': 'December 1, 2017'}

column6: I love the fit on these and I'm an avid lulu wearer but I hate having to constantly lint roll everything away from this fabric. Everything sticks on to it and makes it look like the leggings are constantly dirty. The peeling on these haven't been as bad as the Align ones I've gotten recently (thank goodness) but its annoying having to always clean them up.

I purchased these pants sort of on a whim and they are now my favorite pair of leggings I own. I love the super high waist and the fabric is so soft. I have recommended these leggings to a couple of my friends who also adore the pants. I hope they come out with more colors because I will definitely be purchasing!

column5: Sales Associate said to size up!!! BAD IDEA!
column6: I am a long time loyal lulu customer and have owned a ton of lulus leggings. I was so excited to buy these! I was told in the store in Greenville, SC to buy a size up. I am so disappointed that I listened to the associate who was helping me.I can barely wear these out for a day of errands let alone use them to run or lift in without needing to pull them up constantly. Its the worst and so annoying. I have wore these once since I purchased them because of this terrible issue. I absolutely love the cut and would love them if they fit me correctly. You should definitely order your normal size in these or even a size down!! I wish I had... I am so upset with this purchase.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey UNCGal,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 30, 2017'}

column6: I absolutely loved the fit of these and the feel, BUT they did not pass the squat test. They were completely see through in any bending movement. I cannot have that when doing CrossFit. 100$ pants should be better than this... disappointed.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey OGill,\nOh my, I'm sorry to hear of the coverage issue you're experiencing, and I definitely understand your frustration. We're eager to work out a resolution, so I'm sending you an email to chat more. ", 'LL_response_date': 'November 30, 2017'}

column6: when I tried these leggings on in the store I was so happy because I finally found a pair of great leggings that fit perfectly...flash forward 3 wears later (without even washing them) they're loose around the waist area. Still wearing them but have to constantly pull them up. disappointed

column6: I was really hopeful about these pants, and I was only slightly disappointed with them. They fit super well (a little tight but I don't mind that) and they look fantastic on! The only thing about the fabric is that things stick to them all the time. I feel like I'm always picking off little hairs or always using a lint roller. Also, when I bought the pants there was a little seam coming undone, which I was able to fix, but another seam just got super undone and I can't fix it! I was expecting perfect stitching for what I paid for but I'm pretty disappointed by it. Make sure you inspect all your seams!

column6: Softest leggings I have ever owned or come across. I dont know why Lulu doesn't use this fabric more it is so soft and thick they keep my legs and core so warm! I did not read the reviews of these before purchasing and am glad I didn't because none of the negative reviews are correct for my pair!! By far the best lulu leggings I have ever owned. The length is perfect just above my ankle bone which is the length I look for from longer leggings (for reference I am 5'3 115lb) Absolute perfection!

I was really excited about the potential of these pants. I was hoping they'd live up to their name, but unfortunately, after only one wear, they were already loosening up. I also was SO disappointed with the fact that they attracted every piece of lint within a small radius. By the end of my class, they were full of lint and looked awful. If I had to do it over again, I'd NEVER buy this fabric, as it doesn't hold up at the gym. I'd rather stick with the pants with Full On Luxtreme.

column5: See Through So Embarrassing and Runs Big
column6:
I have these pants in the nocturnal teal and they are definitely see through. I was training at the gym, at 5am thank goodness, and my trainer stopped me and said you can see straight through those tights. The really sad part about it was the lights in the gym were not fully on so imagine if they were all on at the time. I do love these pants and the feel of them so it's a huge bummer that they are see through.
Side note: I think the see through problem is mostly with the nocturnal teal as I bought another pair in the mach blue and they do not seem to be see through.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey MegFit901,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today! We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 26, 2017'}

column6: I went into the store looking specifically for a tight that fit snug. I even mentioned that to the lady that was helping me. She recommended theses to me. I tried them on in my regular size and they fit well. I bought two pairs. After wearing only twice they have significantly relaxed to the point where i'm having to pull them up multiple times in an hour. I would not recommend this tight to anyone. They are not good for any activity or even wearing around the house. Disappointed as I love lulu stuff.

column6: I bought two pairs of these In Movement tights in my usual size 4, and both of them have the same problems. They were smooth and cottony to the touch (but also somewhat compressive), and fit relatively well at first. They do nothing to squish in my lower tummy compared to the Train Times and Align pants, but slimmer ladies might not have this problem. However, throughout the day, the pants became unbearably loose and I could feel them slipping down as I walked. They weren't exactly flattering after they got baggy :(

column6: These are one of the most comfortable pants I have got from Lululemon but the quality has gone increasing downhill within the first week of getting them. I sometimes debate getting size 8 because I am in between a 6 and 8 but I knew to get a smaller size and choose the 6 in these pants and they were still saggy and falling down by the second time I wore them. Also the pilling is extremely bad after only a couple washes and lint seems to get stuck on these like crazy to the point I cant even wear them out of the house. So comfortable but so disappointing.

column5: If it wasn't for the seams!
column6:
I absolutely love the Everlux material- it has the soft appeal from the Nulu material but the sweat wicking ability of Luxtreme. My only concern with these leggings in particular are the seams! I've only worn them 3x and the seams around both the waist and around my shin have unraveled in various spots. I want to continue wearing them because they are unbelievably comfortable, but i'm nervous that the seam unraveling will continue to worsen with time.
On a side note- these leggings fit true to size- I am 5'5" and 135 lbs (athletic build), bought my usual size of a 6.

column5: What'cha doing? Hiking up my pants. AGAIN?!??
column6:
I became ill earlier this year in which I could no longer be active, thus putting on enough weight to no longer be able to squeeze myself in to my size 6 LLL collection. As I began to be able to walk again, I decided to purchase a couple of pairs of LLL pants in my new size (8-10), the In Movement Tight being one of them. I was excited to find something comfortable (Everlux feels great on), in a dark color & not black (Nocturnal Teal!) & not too cottony feeling (like Luon). (The other pants purchased were made of Luxtreme but had to return them as they were slipping down terribly).
I took a size 8 in the In Movement Tight & thought they were the right size. I have worn them all of four times. Despite the comfort level, they are not pleasant to wear since they need constant hiking up (they also pool at the ankles, a first for me). My husband kept asking me what my problem was with my pants. They appear to have stretched out, incomprehensibly! I don't even want to wear them as (very expensive) house-pants due to the never ending slippage.
Maybe some will find this style & fabric to work for them but sadly, I do not. I have watched, but not purchased until now, the new fabrics that have been produced over the last year or so by LLL, & have been intrigued. However, I will not venture forth again having wasted $98. I really wish I could return these.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey BknTX,\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We'd like to turn this around and ensure your gear is providing long lasting performance for you. Since it sounds like this isn't the case, please keep an eye on your inbox so we can get to work on a solution for you.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 20, 2017'}

column5: Love the fit, but seams are coming undone within a few wears
column6: I absolutely love these pants. They feel is soft and and the fit is fantastic, I even bought two pairs. However, within one (hand) wash and hang dry, the seams on one of my pairs is coming undone. Super disappointed because I buy lulu hoping the products would last.

column5: Love-Hate Relationship with this new pant: perfect material, but see-through when you bend over.
column6:
I went into my local Lululemon store yesterday in search of a new pant. I have virtually all the different styles and materials but was looking for something different. I found these and fell in love immediately because they fit so well and were the PERFECT blend of a "naked" and "compression" fit: exactly what I've been looking for!
However....
When I did the bend over test, you could see right through the bum - every detail of the underwear is was wearing. I had on the midnight blue colour because there weren't any black in my size. When I mentioned the issue to the sales associate she agreed that her's were also see-through in the bum when she bent over and that she'd been hearing that complaint from others. This means these are out for every activity that I do: from downward dog to deadlifting. SOOOO disappointing.
Needless to say, I did not make the purchase but absolutely will in the future if this issue gets resolved!
column14: the material was soft and comfortable
column15: they were see-through when i bent over.

column6: I loved the way these feel on and how they looked, and after a few wears and a wash (no dry) they seem to be getting loose. Not sure if maybe a size down would have prevented that from happening or maybe throwing them in the dryer would bring them back to where they were originally. I wanted another colour, now I'm glad I didnt purchase two pair.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Fitray,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 17, 2017'}

column6: I have tried just about every pant Lululemon has made in the last year several years and these are simply amazing - in the top 3 no question. I have worn them to barre, to lift, to travel, and just about everything in between. They are flattering, soft, and the waistband is perfect - keeps a nice seamless line through your torso without shifting. I am genuinely shocked to see how many people have had negative reviews to share. Don't let them deter you! Get a pair... or 3!

column5: Unsure why all the bad reviews
column6: I read through a large number of the reviews and am honestly surprised. These are by far my favorite leggings purchased over the years from Lululemon. I wear a size 2 in the align pants (because they ran a little large) but I ordered my normal size 4 for these leggings. They fit perfectly, no seam issues, no bagginess issues and extreme comfort. I have had them for a few months now and have worn them to run long distances and in spin class. No issues.

column5: Great look, feel, and fit. Don't hold up. Horrible customer service.
column6: Got these while away on vacation. Was extremely excited about my purchase only to find a seam coming undone during the first wear. Wasn't too concerned because I loved the look, feel, and fit and had heard that lululemon had great customer service. Contacted customer service and was told I could return my leggings for store credit if I shipped them to the warehouse (there is not a store locally so I could not return in store). The return label was free but I had to pay for the package, which I didn't mind until I got an email after they reached the warehouse saying that after careful examination my return could not be processed and that the items would be shipped back to me. I have a picture of the torn seams and will be making a trip to the nearest in-store location to voice my complaints once the returned items are shipped back to me.
Wanted to love these so much. They feel great when you put them on but.... they are a lint magnet...so embarrasing!

I Have these 7/8s in teal. I’ve had them now for about 2months and probably worn them 20 times already. They have withheld 20 washes and look brand new like BRAND new. I actually find them more comfortable and flattering than the wunder unders. They are so soft and are good for everything from a heavy workout class to wearing with boots and a sweater. The only thing I have to say is they do attract lint, like a lot.

love, lu lu lemon, and I have a ton a leggings, pants are great at first then you get a ton of piling and it starts to lose form, they get pretty hot and sticky while working out, not a very "second skin" like the women told me in the store.....regrets
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey ssams201,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. I'm so sorry to hear of the pilling and retention issues you're experiencing. column6: I tried these on in store and LOVED how they felt and looked. I own a variety of lulu apparel in different shapes and fits since I'm involved in body building and my size/shape changes frequently. After reading a few reviews and talking with in store staff I opted for a size 2 and was told that they would keep their nice compression like fit. I was very hopeful that this would be the case, I've had three other pairs of various lulu pants get "saggy" within the first couple of months to the point of not even being able to wear them anymore, and with spending such a large chunk of change on lululemon apparel I really expect high quality. Unfortunately, after 1 week and wearing these during a yoga class and weight lifting session they are saggy! I'm SO disappointed because I wanted to love these pants and buy a few more pairs. I really did expect more out of these, especially for the price. I'm a long time lulu lover and have my fair share of lulu products, but something has changed in the quality of their clothing.

column6: I bought two pairs of these because I loved the way they fit and felt on my skin. I wash my pants accordingly to how you are supposed to and I also hang dry them. A month of use and both pairs of my pants are pilling and the stitching is coming apart. I would not suggest paying the high price for terrible quality. Im so disappointed lulu :(

column6: I love these leggings! They are so comfortable and the material is super soft and warmer than a lot of the other leggings out there. The detailing of the sewing is super cute and makes the booty look awesome! Big plus! I haven't experienced any stretching out in these like some reviews are saying. Great leggings!

column5: Coming apart at the seams... sad, because I really liked them
column6: I've had these leggings for a month. I've worn them a lot and they have been super comfortable and rather flattering. I've washed them only twice and both times I followed care instructions strictly. However, on taking them out of the wash today (second time I've washed them) I noticed that the seam on the top band had unraveled 2 inches! I paid over $100 and had to save up for a while to make that purchase... it's unacceptable for them to be coming apart already...especially since I have $25 dollar leggings that I bought 4 years ago that still have all their stitching intact... I've been super happy with these leggings up until today.

column5: Not a good alternative to my fave Align pants
column6:
I was really excited to try out these pants after hearing others say they're a cross between the Aligns and Wunder Unders. I love the Aligns but wanted something more technical and sturdy for my HIIT classes. Sadly, these are not going to be the other holy grail Lulu pants I was hoping for. For some reason, there is less fabric in various parts of the crotch/bum area so this makes it slightly see-through. I'm not sure why this is the case but personally, I feel like there's less thickness in fabric than the Align pants. I also get the dreaded camel toe in these a lot.
I think people have been sizing up because of the compression and fit of the In Movement pants but based on what I've heard about how these are similar to Aligns, I thought they should be sized likewise and I haven't had a problem with sagging or having to readjust constantly. FYI - I wear size 4 in Aligns and also got these in size 4. I got both the pants and the crops so pretty bummed about having jumped the gun. Almost but not yet Lulu!

column6: These are super comfy! My new favorite. They hug well without being overly rigid and restrictive. I wear them to teach barre and Pilates and they stay in place and wick sweat. The garnet color is lovely for the fall. They can pick up lint, so if you have pets that shed, these may not be a good choice for you. Would love more colors!

column5: Saggy, Loose Seams, and Giant Hole
column6: I have owned these pants for about a month. The fabric is great for high intensity workouts, and doesn't pill. However, the pants have stretched out in the butt and waistband, and are no longer flattering. What's worse is that the seams in the crotch area have become loose, exposing a giant hole. I can no longer wear these $108 dollar pants that I had super high hopes for. I thought these pants were of exceptional quality, until this happened.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey purplematcha,\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback. I'd love to get a bit more information on your experience and look into some options. An email is headed your way, so keep an eye out.", 'LL_response_date': 'November 4, 2017'}

column5: Happy at first but after the 20th readjustment was very irritated.....
column6: I was really looking forward to this new line because I was told it felt like the align yet you could wear for everyday use outside of class as well. That may be true but what they didn't tell me was how much it would stretch out during wear! The first time I wore it was to a hot yoga class and during the entire class I kept pulling up the waist band and down the legs because the were sagging and loose in all the wrong places. For yoga pants this shouldn't happen at all let alone when you spend $100 for them! Not happy with this model at all
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Kathy89,\nOh dear. Thanks for taking the time to share this feedback with us- we always want to ensure that our gear is performing for you as intended, and will be sending you an email so we can chat further.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 2, 2017'}

column6: I love the idea of these pants. Meant for training, rather than yoga or running. I wear a 26/27 in pants and typically find myself purchasing lululemon tights in size 4. So far, the size 4 has worked for me. I have three colors: black, nocturnal teal, and black cherry. None are see-through. I noticed the black cherry waist seam seems pretty stiff, so as I was pulling them over my hips I could hear some ripping of the seams. I hope this doesnt lead to holes or the waist unraveling. Maybe lululemon could add reinforced stitching in this area with a stretchier waistband. My favorite tights from lululemon are the High Times in the full on luon fabric. However, with the type of workouts I do, I find that the fabric can feel a bit scratchy when my legs rub together. I have other tights, made of luxtreme, and nulu which are fine, but I'm not crazy about the shine those fabrics have. The everlux fabric of these tights are super soft, don't feel scratchy at all and don't have very little sheen. My workouts consist of cardio, high intensity, and strength training. I found them to feel quite comfortable and cool. I have worn my black pair a few times already and washed them. I haven't noticed any piling, but I have had lots of luck with my lululemon tights and have never had issues with piling (only wash with other workout fabrics/and air dry only). People mentioned that they found the fabric feeling like it stretches out after wear, which they do feel a bit "saggy" after initial wear, but they don't look saggy at all. As far as the tights attracting lint, I noticed it too, but it's not that bad in my opinion. Overall I'm very happy with these tights and look forward to purchasing even more colors!

I fell in love with these the first time I tried them on. I did an Orange Theory Class in them and they were perfect. But then they began to sag out. I'm a TTS 6 and now these are no longer tight, they don't stay up and they sag. I should've paid closer attention to the reviews and sized down because they definitely stretch out. So bummed!!!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi Pokeyholly,\nSorry to hear that your In Movement 7/8 Tight isn’t holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.', 'LL_response_date': 'November 1, 2017'}

column6: I really wanted to love these. I do a lot of spin and was excited to have a pant that was made for the studio. Unfortunately, I was disappointed the first time I wore these. The waist stretched out almost immediately and were falling down the entire class. I'm not sure I will be wearing these any more because the waist has loosened so badly.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Schu,\nI'm sorry to hear the waistband has stretched out! We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 31, 2017'}

column6: I absolutely loved these pants when I first got them! They were snug but not too tight. After wearing them two times, the waistband seam started to unravel and now the pants barely stay up! column5: Very baggy and too high rise!
column6: I've been an avid wunder under fan since I started wearing Lululemon but have been trying to branch out and try new products. I can honestly say on the shelf these looked awesome but when I got them home they were way too high! and pretty much hit my sports bra. They were saggy in the crotch and I could tell they were going to stretch. As someone who is typically between a 4/6 there is no way I was even attempting to go to a 2. I plan on returning for a pair of aligns.

I spent a quite a while in the store trying to find the right pair and these happen to be it! I loved how they made me feel and look. The only downside is that after wearing them only 2 times, the seam at the crotch unraveled and now there is a big piece of string hanging from my crotch area. I expected better quality after paying $100 for these.

column6: Loved these when I tried them on, fit super well and comfortable. Took them hiking and they got so so saggy and I had to pull them up all the time. Bought my regular size that is usually very consistent at Lululemon. Also wore them to the gym and same thing, they were so saggy and had to constantly yank them up. Pretty disappointed, they seemed so great when I tired them in store and was looking forward to using these for the gym this winter, but no dice.
