column6: i bought these tights in both the maroon and black color and never find myself reaching for them. they attract lint like nobody's business, the slit for the hidden pocket is extremely uncomfortable (it almost feels like it pinches me?), they give me a CRAZY cameltoe, and i'm constantly tugging them back up while working out even after sizing down. i'm really bummed about these because i absolutely adore my tight stuff tights and all my speed shorts, but these were just super disappointing.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey mountaingirl926,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 28, 2017'}

column6: I bought these in the garnet color because I loved the seam design and I hate feeling sweaty in my leggings!!! I was looking for a good longer legging for the winter so that I am warm all day but stay cool in the studio. These seem like they will deliver! Fit true to size, the seams are very flattering, and after one wash (hanging dry of course!) they still look great, so I must have gotten a lucky batch after reading some other reviews... I really like the waistband and seamless fit, I'll probably be picking them up in black soon! Hoping for some light spring colors/prints soon too :) They are very soft and definitely do pick up a little bit of lint and fuzz but not so much that it's a huge issue. I have worn them to barre classes so far to test them out but am looking forward to wearing them to cycling classes now that I know they'll do their job!

I ordered these last month and LOVED these straight out of the package. So soft, perfect fit, perfect waist band, amazing look. Now, after two weeks of wearing them maybe four times, the seams are coming unraveled. I haven't even worked out in them, just work them to work! It's nothing short of disappointing to spend $98 on a pair of pants that don't hold up. I have tons of other pants from lulu.... while I understand pilling is a thing, usually the seams at lease hold up until they hit the one year mark!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Mizliz,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 25, 2017'}

column5: this fabric is amazing...but there are stitching issues.
column6: Within a week, I purchased 1 pair of these leggings and then ran back to the store and bought 2 more. The fabric is so unbelievably soft and the perfect compression. I was in love! I put on my pair in the color aeon on to go workout but when I got home and took them off, I noticed the stitching was unraveling on the back. I went back to the store and they quickly exchanged them for a new pair (lulu customer service always at it's finest). I put the new pair on today and wore them about casually for the day. I looked down at my leg this evening to find the stitching unraveling, again. Maybe it's just an issue with this color? But alas, back to the store...again :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi brookeee,\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback. I would love to chat more about the unraveling stitching you’re experiencing so we can help turn your experience around. Keep your eye out for a follow up email so we can continue this conversation.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 25, 2017'}

column6: These leggings are awesome. They look great, stay up when I'm running/lifting and are super comfy. The waistband isn't too high on me (I'm 5'2) and the length is, coincidentally, a perfect full-length!

column5: In love at first.. then wore.
column6: I LOVED these pants at first. So much that I got the black and the garnett color. They feel like aligns but fit more structured, which is amazing. However, my first black pair, the seam popped during my first time wearing and the lint collection was so bad. So I returned and tried it again because I was still in love. After one more wear with these new ones, they collect lint SO BADLY that I am almost embarrassed to wear these $98 leggings. With how much lint they collect, they do NOT seem worth the money at all. Extremely disappointed.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey AlMarie,\nI hear your disappointment with the performance of your In Movement 7/8 Tight *Everlux and will be following up with an email so I can dig into this with you.\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 24, 2017'}

column6: This is the perfect mixture of Nulu or Rulu or whatever you have and luxtreme, they are slightly compressing but still feel like butter on your skin. I never want to take them off. I have washed them a couple times and all thumbs up here as well. I have not worked out in them as they are full pants and i prefer a crop, but I will be ordering the crops next to give a try. Good job, lulu!

These feel as soft as the Align tights. However, I like these even more! They feel as tho I could really work out in them (I only wear the Align for leisure/lounging). So comfy yet I feel more support! These will be great for the cooler months ahead too. Just like the Align....you need to size down. I would have given 5 stars but the back slit pocket inside the waist band feels ichy at times. Wish it wasn't there at all.

I absolutely love these pants. I have the Align pant in 4 different colors and needed to find another pair of pants that I liked. Luckily I found these! They are similar to the Align pant but have a little more structure. I use these pants for everyday wear, yoga, and working out in the gym. Great purchase.

I was so excited about these, and was extremely disappointed when they arrived. The material is no different than a pair of leggings from Target. I would never recommend these. I don't mind paying lulu prices because the quality and fit almost never disappoint, but this seems to be the exception. VERY disappointed.

Bought the Garnet Crop and Black 7/8 tight of same size, need to size down as Align by the way. The crop is perfect, but don't know why the black tight is so different. It's less stretchy and hard to pull up, feel very restricted around the knee and waist part, not flattering at all. And the material attracts lint so easily.

I love these pants. They are like the align pants, but you can actually run in them! I was looking for a pair like that because my align pants are my favorite pants ever, but unfortunately I cannot do cardio in them. These are the aligns of cardio!!! Love them and hope that lulu makes more colors!
Material is the perfect mix of a running pant/yoga pant. It is super comfortable and you can get sweaty in them!

I can't get enough of these pants. They're exactly what I need as a fitness instructor. I bought them in black, wore them, and immediately washed them so I could wear them again. They're just tight enough, supportive, and high waisted. Your legs will look amazing in these. I want a pair for every day of the week. TBH, I'm thinking of buying another black pair.
I'm between a size 8 and a size 6, so I tried on both. I went with a 6 and they're perfect.
Can't wait for more colors!

column5: A big no! I think these underperform.
column6:
I was excited to try these, particularly since the tag states that these are marketed for being able to wear for studio then cycling classes, so I was excited to try them. These are a huge fail in my opinion if you plan to sweat!
Pros: These are deliciously soft and initially comfortable. They definitely move well, and do not constrict in any way. I wore these for two indoor cycling classes, and there has been no evidence of pilling, fuzzing of thread, or popped stitching.
Cons: In my opinion, these do not remotely stand up to a sweaty workout!! The crotch and bottom area retained sweat, making them uncomfortably bag out. It felt (and looked) as if I'd peed my pants. These are a huge fail in my opinion. Just a big no. As an aside, these tights are like a magnet for dust, lint, you name it.
I think that these unequivocally fit a half to full size larger, and I purchased these in my smaller size. If I had not read the hang tag, I would've said that these are the naked sensation.
column9: SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA, CA, USA
column11: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.
column15: can't use them for their intended purpose!

column6:
First of all, I'd like to define myself as a big fan of your products,Lulu.
Until now, although I saw a lot of negative reviews on your website, I had a strong faith in quality of your products, and the name value of Lululemon.
But the first time I tried this pants, I found out it did have a problem, had weird scrathes on it.
Unfortunately I'm in China for a while, I couldn't ask you guys to refund.
But I really want to ask you to deal with qualty control problem.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi Leslie0054,\nI'm sorry to hear you're experiencing scratches on your tights. We would love to get a bit more information on your experience, and look into some options. An email is headed your way, so keep an eye out.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 18, 2017'}

column6: Lulu has created a winning fabric! I've owned these pants for a month and they have not pilled or snagged, even after deadlifting (lots of barbell contact), and rock climbing in them. The seams have also stayed put after a month (this is usually when my other Lulu pants unravel, unfortunately). Overall, I'm very impressed. Please make other pants in this material, Lulu, I will buy them all!! HOWEVER, I got these in my usual size 6, and they have stretched out a bit, so I would recommend sizing down. I constantly have to hike these up, which is not fun.

column5: The best fabric yet, but unraveling waist
column6: This Everlux fabric is unbelievable. One of my favorites by far, so I highly recommend! I own every single style of Lulu pants, and these are definitely my favorite and great for any type of sweat session. Unfortunately, the waistline has unraveled, after my first wear. So, be careful of that.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Klax88,\nI’m sorry to hear you’re experiencing unraveling seams with your gear. Please know we stand behind the quality of our gear and I’d love to dig into this with you. Hang tight for an email coming your way!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 17, 2017'}

column6: This guest did not provide a text review.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Glad to hear you're loving it! What classes did you take it to?", 'LL_response_date': 'October 16, 2017'}

column6: I love, love, this material. Typically I purchase luxtreme bottoms for my workouts, but wanted to try something new. Everlux feels like it took the best part of every fabric lulu offers and combined it in one perfect combination. In store I was told it was as if nulu and luxtreme had a baby. My only complaint is the fit. I have purchased all my lulu bottoms in an 8 and they all fit perfectly. However, after wearing these bottoms for a while they started to stretch out a bit and needed to constantly be pulled up. I'd love for these to be my go to workout pants but they just don't hold up over time like my luxtreme.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Theyareworthit,\nNo one likes their pants stretching out—that's definitely a thumbs down from us. We've sent through an email so we can learn more about your experience and look into some options.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 17, 2017'}

column5: I love Lululemon, but I don't love these
column6: I thought these were amazing when I first bought them... its been like 2-3 weeks and they are already pilling, the seams of them are coming apart (I've worn them maybe 3 times??), and they have stretched out so much they are now like 2 sizes too big. I love lululemon items, I am a dedicated buyer, but I'm EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED with this product.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Monty123,\nThanks for taking the time to reach out today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and are sorry to hear your gear isn't performing. Give our GEC a call at 1.877.263.9300 so they can follow up and chat.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 17, 2017'}

column6: I actually went into the store looking for a specific pair of pants that I loved a lot, then came across these new ones. I was interested so I tried them on and really liked the different feel that they gave me. Im a little short so they are a little longer than I would like them to be, which was no surprise. But I was so excited to try them out at the gym so I wore them the next day at my cycle studio and all went well but the next day during a cycle class a thread came loose by my butt. Not only did this become a loop and I was worried I now had a hole in my pants, but this loop it created kept getting stuck on the seat of my bike when we would stand!! While it turned out there was no hole it was horrible that this happened on my second use. I shop at Lululemon frequently and this was by far the most disappointing thing that has happened. I wish I had read some of the similar reviews before buying.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi Fitness123,\nYikes—this doesn’t sound good. We stand behind the quality of our gear and would love to know more about your experience with this. Keep your eye out, an email is on its way.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 16, 2017'}

column6: These are the softest pants I've ever owned. I am normally a size 4, but I did order these pants in a size 6 according to reviews. I was solo in love when these came in the mail. The color was beautiful and just soft to the touch! However, once I tried on the pants, the seams at the waistband came apart.. very disappointed about that. These were gonna be my new favorite pants :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi kjfla,\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I’d love to chat about the unraveling seams you’re experiencing so we can help turn your experience around. I’ve sent you an email to follow up so we can continue the conversation — chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'October 16, 2017'}

column6: I purchased these pants in-store about two weeks ago and I was hooked. For 7 days of moderate work-outs and running around doing errands these pants were the best. It wasn't until I washed them I started to change my tune. I followed the wash instructions--machine wash cold and line dry. As with the early reviews about the seams, I encountered a similar issue. One of the seams on the top waistband started to come loose and I started to notice a little fraying on some side seams. Another issue I had after washing them was the fit. It wasn't the same. It didn't give the same hugged feeling as when you first put them on. Full discretion, when I first thought about buying these pants they were a bestseller item. Now they're no longer on that page.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi Botin2LemonHypeNotWrthIt,\nThanks for taking the time to share your feedback. We would love to get a bit more information on your experience, and look into some options. An email is headed your way, so keep an eye out.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 16, 2017'}

column6: I have been shopping at lululemon for years now and absolutely love their products, recently bought the align pant and love them but wanted a more athletic legging so that's why I bought these. I just purchased the In Movement 7/8 tight only a few weeks ago and the seams on the waist band are already unraveling. This has seemed to loosen the pants which cause them to fall down a great deal. Im so sad cause I do love lululemon products, but was a tad disappointed that these unraveled so quickly after I purchased them.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi hannahlynn98,\nYikes—this doesn’t sound good. We stand behind the quality of our gear and would love to know more about your experience with this. Keep your eye out, an email is on its way.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 16, 2017'}

column6:
I purchased these pants based on blend of the material (see other reviews): soft like Align (yoga) but tough like train-time (gym). These sounded perfect. However, I ignored the remaining, negative reviews:
1. Attracts lint. I accept, as a pet owner, I need to lint-roll my clothing. However, none of my previous Lulu purchases required as much brush action as these pants. And, like prior reviews, not all the lint came off!
2. Not a high rise. I love my lulu high rise pants, especially for yoga. However, these are not a high-rise (unless you want camel toes).
3. Sizing. I wear a 4-6, depending on the material. I went with the 6 in these based on reviews about poor rear coverage during gym workouts. After one use: snag in a seam and stretched waist. So my rear is covered but my leggings don't fit properly.
Prior to wearing (1x) I considered returning as I was not "in love" with the color I selected. Should have gone with my gut and returned for a style I know and like. Tags removed = Worst $98 purchase.
-
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hi Schofka,\nI’d love to lend a hand with some solutions so I’ve sent you an email that outlines the next steps. Chat soon!', 'LL_response_date': 'October 13, 2017'}

column6: What I'd give to replace all my luon with everlux. Love these pants - they fit TTS and the material is fabulous. Cozy, soft and doesn't stretch out after multiple wears. The waist is fitted but with no drawstring they aren't my first choice for running/jumping activities. Hope Lulu comes out with a wunder under in this material.

column5: As if nulu and luxtreme had a baby- MAGICAL
column6:
These are my all time fave go-to lulus now! The fabric is cotton-like to the touch similar to the nulu on the Aligns, but tough and durable feeling like the luxtreme fabric on the Train times.
I was able to snag a pair in the Garnet colorway and absolutely love the color.
High rise fitting, and true to size like a luxtreme style. I've worn these 3-4 times for weight lifting, cardio,and HIIT and no signs of loose threads or pilling! Totally squatproof!
I'm obsessed w/ the Align 2's but hate that they pill like a mother and have to be handled so delicately. Everlux is the holy grail of buttery soft fabric and I can't wait for more styles to come out in this. The panels and lines of this style are also super flattering and do the booty good :)
If you're on the fence don't be, buy them!

First of all THE MATERIAL-- amazing, its so soft and light. it feels like youre wearing nothing but still holds you in. The length and seams are SO flattering. I am in love. i never want to buy another pair of leggings again. If you are considering buying these, do it. By far my favorite Lulu pants and pair of legging in general.

These are literally everything I look for in a tight. High rise, hugged, 25". Fit is awesome and the everlux reminds me of luxtreme which is my favorite fabric. I've already worn these a couple times to the gym for training. No issues.

Just purchased these pants yesterday with intentions to wear them to spinning class today, but once I had them on, I realized there is a hole in the knee! The pants seem to be double layered and the top layer has a whole, so its not noticeable, but I'm too scared to wear and wash them as a the hole may go through the second layer. I already took the tag off, so I'm going to see if I can return them today.
Otherwise, I love the feel of the pants, but sadly I have no performance review...just make sure you check for holes!!
Also, the waist band it very snug and a little unforgiving like other Lulu pants. And the black color attracts everything! Make sure you carry a lint roller with you!
column9: SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA, CA, USA
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Bluelissa,\nOh dear. Thanks for taking the time to share this feedback with us- we always want to ensure that our gear is performing for you as intended, and will be sending you an email so we can chat further.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 9, 2017'}

column6: These leggings are very thick so although they absorb sweat well they do not keep you cool at all. I wore them during a hot yoga class and never again! Nulux is much better at keeping you cool. I don't think you could even wear these outside in spring/summer - you'd overheat! There is no drawstring so I was constantly pulling them up mid yoga class. I think they run a bit big - I should have ordered a size down (actually I wish I hadn't ordered them at all!).

These pants are so comfy and make me feel great!! I never want to take them off. They pull everything in which makes me look so sleek. Would definitely recommend. The fabric is perfect for yoga and on the go.

I usually don't write reviews, but I feel like these pants are misleading. I tried on in the store and loved the feel (like fast & frees and aligns had a baby) and how great my booty looked. I ordered the garnet color from another store since they were out of my size and couldn't wait to pop the tags for my OTF class... BUT the first thing I noticed was some faulty stitching on the back- it was doubled back in a couple places, but they were near the seams so I thought, ok, maybe this was some kind of intentional reinforcing. Something I could live with- at least it wasn't unraveling. I wore to class and good god i could feel the butt and leg sweat pooling... let's be real and not even pretend that no one gets this. Maybe if these were in a print it wouldn't have been so bad, but they definitely didn't wick sweat like the ed said they would (no fault of her own, it's in the description). I waited an hour to change at home to see if they would eventually dry and they somewhat did... but really? Maybe if I was doing some light lifting or a walk around the neighborhood, these would've been great... but they definitely didn't leave me "feeling cool and dry during your sweatiest workouts" during "an intense studio session" Now I feel bad that I splurged on a pair of tights that I definitely can't work out in. If I wanted everyday leggings, I would've bought another pair of WU or aligns
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey coloradogirl988,\nOh dear. Thanks for taking the time to share this feedback with us- we always want to ensure that our gear is performing for you as intended, and will be sending you an email so we can chat further.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 8, 2017'}

column6: After saving up some money I finally decided to order my second pair of lulu's. I was very excited because they even arrived at my house the day after ordering even with free shipping which was great! I made sure to wash these properly and only have worn them casually. The fabric was great and even after wearing way too many times in the short amount of time that I had these I experienced no pilling and they were not see through at all. Today I noticed that a seam in the inside of the waist band is coming loose and unraveling which is very disappointing considering the price and the amount of time that i have had these. I love these pants just wish the seams held up better :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey klur12,\nI hear your disappointment with the performance of your In Movement 7/8 Tight and will be following up with an email so I can dig into this with you.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 6, 2017'}

column6:
I have always been an avid Wunder Under wearer, but I felt it was time to venture out of my comfort zone. I am a 5'3" Oly lifter/CrossFitter with a athletic/muscular build (read: smaller waist thick booty and legs), so the Wunder Unders, including high waisted, tend to fall on me. Size wise, I sit in between a 4 and 6, so due to reviews here I went with a size 4. I feel like the size was appropriate and I loved they way they fit, except for the teeny tiny seem along the top of the waist line that immediately popped simply by adjusting the waistband. Having a sewing background, i can only assume this seam must be to hold the integrity on the top of the waistline, yet there was no strength to the seam and it lacked proper elasticity. I also felt like the waist was nice and compressing yet the thigh area had too much space yet, so if I had gone with a size 6, I would be pulling them up all the time. So sadly these will be getting returned.
Lulu, you were almost there with these ones!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey coach80,\nOh no! We hear your disappointment and will be sending an email your way to follow up and lend a helping hand.\nSpeak soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 6, 2017'}

column6: Material is super soft and breathable. However, EVERYTHING clings to them! I don't have pets in my house but have managed to pick up every floating particle and fuzz in the air on these bad boys. ALSO the laser cut pocket in the waistband is SUPER itchy where it sits on your back, so that's a major downfall. Might be taking them in to get it sewn shut.
column15: laser cut pocket clingyness of the material

column5: GREAT material, but poor quality control
column6:
When these first arrived, I was absolutely IN LOVE. The material is slightly thicker than luxtreme (and therefore squat-proof for me when I stayed TTS) with all the buttery softness of nulu. The high-waist cut paired with the seams make for an incredibly flattering fit. (One thing to note about the fit is that the waistband is narrower than the train times pant, so it doesn't have quite as much tummy-control.) Once I put them on, I did not want to take them off. Despite its thickness, the everlux material itself is super breathable and sturdy for high intensity workouts.
HOWEVER, after one crossfit workout (before washing!), the seams in the waistband are unraveling. I'm really hoping that this is just a defect in the pair that I was sent. Other than this defect, I would give this pant a 5; however, because this is a pretty major defect, I had to knock it down to a 3. If I can exchange it for another pair that doesn't have this defect, I will definitely be coming back for more colors.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey newLuluLover09,\nI hear your disappointment with the performance of your In Movement 7/8 Tight and will be following up with an email so I can dig into this with you.\nChat soon', 'LL_response_date': 'October 5, 2017'}

column6:
I had to return these in mach blue because the front waistband seam popped, after first time wearing them. Looks like seams aren't as flexible as the actual material.
returned in store and all the other ones in-store had the same seam popped. I would wait until they come out with the second round of everlux pants because they are awesome but that seam problem bugs me. The mach blue is beautiful and I love the nulu feel with the cardio proof fabric! love love love and miss having the mach blue :(
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey collegegymyogi,\nI hear your disappointment with the performance of your In Movement 7/8 Tight and will be following up with an email so I can dig into this with you.\nChat soon', 'LL_response_date': 'October 5, 2017'}

column6:
I wanted to love these pants. I was hyped when I first saw them in my email and when I tried them on in store, they felt great. So, I decided to put them through the ultimate sweaty test- a spin class followed by a hot yoga class.
Spin- these pants felt great. They had me feeling dry throughout the class and I was able to push my limits. But- I felt "dry", not necessarily "cool" as advertised. My legs got very hot, which I didn't mind, but when I left the studio I realized my legs were COVERED in huge sweat marks. I may have felt dry, but I sure didn't look it. It was kind of gross, and not a look I ever encountered with Lulu before- especially a pair that's being marketed as a spin pant.
Yoga- the high waist was great, and I wore the pants with the same bra as the ad. Felt good throughout class, but the waistband kept rolling down.
When I got home, I realized one of my seams came undone. Really? The first time I wore them? Sad. I'm disappointed in the quality of these pants.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey Neens,\nWe stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 5, 2017'}

column5: Reiterating other reviews.. these tights are awesome!
column6:
As another reviewer said, these pants are the child of Aligns and ATRP. I tried all three on in the store at the same time - and I went with these! Aligns were too slick (and I liked the others had stitching along the sides and more support). ATRP are great but these were $20 cheaper so I thought I'd give them a try. I am in between a 4 and 6 in bottoms and went with a 4 (like I do with WUP).
The fabric is amazingly soft. As others say, it does attract lint.. but I wouldn't say it's anymore than my WUP in Luon. I love the "cooling" these give - it's hard to describe, but they are so light and thin while still maintaining coverage and are squat proof! They dry quickly. I cannot comment on their durability, but after one wash and two wears, I have no visable use.
The ONE downside I would give is the waistband. It kind of bunched on me and wouldn't stay completely flat all the time (like the top layer of fabric kind of rolled up, but the bottom stayed in place. I'd definitely buy them again!
These pants are amazing and so soft yet great to run in. Love em!

I'm normally a 4 at Lululemon because I like tighter fit. I've got bigger thighs so these were a little harder to pull over my legs and hips. It seems like the seam on the waist is not as stretchy as the actual fabric is so it's a little limiting there. Each time I adjust them or take them on or off, I'm worried about ripping it.. I've worn them for 1 yoga class so far but will definitely try them with other activities. The Garnet color is gorgeous!

I wore them for the first time today to a spin class and they were amazing. I was so sweaty but these pants kept me dry. I would definitely recommend these.I love the stitching along the legs gives it an interesting look! Do not hesitate to try these pants!!!

These work wonders in spin class!!! Keeps it so you don't overheat - This is like my 74382 pair of lulu lemon pants, and unfortunately they are the first ones to have the seam come undone :( I will try to take them in and see what they can do for me. I've only worn them 2 times and washed once.... That's the only downside and I don't think it's this style specifically, more so just this random pair.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey lbrown,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 4, 2017'}

column6: I bought these in Black size 4 when they first came out and fell in love! The fabric is awesome and sweat wicking and super comfortable. I raved so much about them that my bf bought me the same pair in nocturnal teal while traveling. I was so excited until I wore the teal ones the first time. For some reason this pair stretched out like crazy after only wearing them around the house and the LINT! EVERYTHING STICKS TO THIS PAIR LIKE CRAZY! I did not have this problem at all with the black pair so I don’t know if it’s only the nocturnal teal or if I just got a bad pair? The lint does not come off easy at all either. I don’t even know where it came from- the only thing I wore with them is a CRB tank. I’m so disappointed.
column15: fabric stretching out and lint sticking like crazy
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey LakeT,\nWe hear your disappointment and will be sending an email your way to follow up and lend a helping hand.\nSpeak soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 4, 2017'}

column6: YASS! I get so much much criticism from all my friends who work for Lulu whenever i train in my aligns! This legging is the perfect alternative or my ladies who love to train and are obsessed with the aligns! No pilling yet! Honestly sooo hooked and i usually never write reviews but I HAD TO! I went with my align size and it was perfect! Waist area isn't as giving but I didn't mind that Excited for more colors! Keep em coming :)

Absolutely love these. They are super flattering. I like to wear very tight leggings and I wear a size 2 always. I was between a 2 and 4 here; the 2 has a tight waistband which was somewhat hard to pull over my legs, but the 4 waist was too loose so I still stuck with the 2. Overall, so cute and I love the new fabric. Thinking about getting these in another color :)

Super upset because I love the feel of the fabric but they're not squat proof. Tried on my true size 6 and they were completely sheer when bending over. Then, I tried on size 8 and they were too loose around my butt.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey HB123,\nOh my, I'm sorry to hear of the coverage issue you're experiencing, and I definitely understand your frustration. We're eager to work out a resolution, so I'm sending you an email to chat more. ", 'LL_response_date': 'October 3, 2017'}

column5: Amazing fabric, but has one downside.
column6: I absolutely love these pants. They are like the Aligns but for high intensity workouts (I did some HIIT today with these and they were amazing!) The fabric is buttery and soft but sweat-wicking. These stayed up during my sprints and I never had a problem with the waistband (which I sometimes have to pull up on my other tights). The only flaw I would say is that it attracts SO MUCH LINT. I wore these today for the first time and while in the gym there was lint everywhere on my pants just from being in the gym!!! Like another reviewer pointed out, the lint does not come off simply. A bit disappointed because I might not keep these because the lint problem makes the leggings look old. I am hoping it is just a bad batch...

I tried these pants on after receiving them for all of three minutes. I like the fit and style - can't you just make a luxtreme or fullux pant like this and call it a day?
Everlux as a material has a nice hand-feel, but it doesn't seem to be high quality or long-wearing. The pair I received has comically bad stitching on a seam right at center back below the logo - poor quality control. As I commented on another review below, it was like they were actively sucking ambient lint and dust out of the room. Pants that attract this much lint from nowhere from three minutes of wearing are going to look terrible in no time and will likely pill quickly and easily. The waistband in my regular size is too big and sags and wrinkles around my waist - lame - and I think sizing down might make these less than opaque. The Everlux feels nice on and looks flattering but isn't compressive. These don't seem like a good choice for technical anything. The garnet color is totally underwhelming in person. I will likely return these due to the above issues so won't have a chance to try them for an actual workout, but even assuming these hold up for actual fitness endeavors, it seems like they would show sweat very easily based on the material.

These are my first lulu leggings, I was nervous about purchasing because I have seen reviews about piling on other leggings besides this one, but as of today I am in LOVE. I wear these for heavy lifting, cardio (stair master & plyometrics), and lounging. They are the most comfortable leggings I have ever worn, I have them in black and they dried pretty quickly after 120 minutes of training and cardio. I will definitely be purchasing in more colors! They are perfect and don't make you feel really hot/sweaty even though you might be both lol.
This is my first purchase from lululemon and I am rather disappointed in the quality of the seams on the leggings. I haven't even owned these for a month and the seam on the cuff is unraveling.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey vi3r,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!\nChat soon.', 'LL_response_date': 'October 3, 2017'}

column6: Saw these in store and debated on them as I have tried both the align II and the pushing limits and loved them, but they pilled a bit for me. So far so good with these. They are SO FLATTERING, and so comfortable. More durable than the pushing limits and align so I have no concern wearing them for my heavier work outs. I will definitely be ordering more colours in these soon!

My favorite pants from Lulu are the aligns. Alas, they are so delicate, I am always hesitant to wear them to do anything but yoga. I have been waiting for a more durable version for a long time.
After reading the other reviews, I went to the Lulu store to check out this new fabric. Its wonderful! Very much like the light weight/buttery align material. Excited not to have to "baby" this pair and to be able to wear for other activities than yoga.
I am not crazy about all of the seams, however they do accentuate the legs, so I still give 5 stars.
I am 5'7", 130lbs, and wear a size 4, and these fit TTS.

Bought these in a size 10 because the reviews are so good. They're awesome! I'm 5'9, 175lbs bought my normal size 10. Wore them to spin class and they stayed up, felt airy/light, wicked really well, and no sweat stains. I sweat a lot, so I'm in the market for these in other colours. These are soft and perform well, as comfy as the Align Pant but more sporty- I usually lounge in my Aligns. These are a great tight for working out!

So these tights are pretty comfortable, stay in place and definitely keep you cool. That being said, these are 100% NOT SQUAT PROOF. I could tell immediately before even putting them on I'd have to be careful bending slightly let alone squatting so I wasn't showing the whole gym my underwear. Nice design I just wish the material was luxtreme instead.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hi ZiggySatrdust,\nThank you for taking the time to share your feedback. I'm sorry to hear that you’re experiencing coverage concerns with your pants. We stand by the quality of our gear and I'd like to make this right. Keep an eye on your inbox, as I'll be reaching out shortly to get the ball rolling on a solution for you.", 'LL_response_date': 'October 2, 2017'}

column6: I bought these in the cranberry color in a size 4. They feel SO amazing and wearing to a spin class this weekend to take them for a SPIN ;) This only gets a 4 because I think these actually ran big even though the reviews say they run small. They are extremely high waist on me and the legs are long. I'm only 5'4 and 7/8 tights normally are the perfect length for me, this seemed to have a bit extra length.

column5: Great design, but bring a lint roller...
column6: I purchased these pants in the garnet and aeon (sp?? teal blue color) in my normal size 4 (5'4", 115lbs). It's possible I could have sized down. The leg and waist band seem a little looser than in the LUXTREME fabric, which has more of a compression feeling. However, pants fit well and the band is high rise so it wasn't too bothersome. I read one review that indicated "beware crotch sweat." The garnet color shows a bit more sweat than the darker teal color - fyi. However, neither color show as much as some of the lighter colors in the NULUX fabric. I used these In-Movement pants in a mixed martial arts class and well as a heavy lifting day. Following a sweat session of 1 hour, I did a mat class for 30 min. Pants were pretty much dry by the end of the 1/2 hour. My only complaint is the amount of lint the fabric picks up throughout the day. I found myself lint-rolling constantly, but I'm a SUPER picky neat freak.
I've been a fan of high waisted pants, and these are the best. I wore them to both orange theory fitness and to yoga and felt amazing in them.

I tried it at for a few minutes at home. The fit and feel are very nice. I sized down based on recommendation by the store rep since there is not a waist tie. When I sat on a rug, it attracted lint and pet hair right away! I was trying to brush off the lint and pet hair with my hand and they didn't come off easily. I then tried on the Train Times pants and another Lulu Run pants to compare, and they did not attract lint/hair. I will return these pants. Disappointed because I like them a lot.

These pants feel amazing! They are so soft against the skin, and they wick sweat and dry so quickly (practically magic)! They're good for running and training! They are opaque but breathable. I am in love, I hope this fabric is here to stay!
They are a tad longer than most 7/8 pants, but they are perfect for the fall weather coming up!
They fit TTS!

If you're contemplating on whether or not to buy these just do it, they are worth it. I normally don't write reviews, but these are just that great! These remind me of a mixture of the aligns and fast and free tights. I love that I can wear these for weight training and cardio and that I don't have to "baby" them when wearing them to the gym because the material is quite durable. So far, no pilling on the inner thigh after washing them a few times. I also really like the touch of compression (not restricting whatsoever) for added support! Also, the seams really really REALLY flatter the booty and quads. I would love to see these in a variety of colors including a light gray and royal blue, please.

I went to my store with the sole intention of trying these on because I was intrigued by the fabric mix. I have the Aligns and they are lovely soft, but I am forever nervous about washing them in case of pilling. The salesperson told me these were like a hardier version of the Align material. They feel great! I go between a 6 and an 8 and tried on the 8 first and they fit pretty well, so I didn't try the 6, but I am wondering if maybe it would benefit the fabric for working out if I sized down to the 6 for more compression. In the end though, the 8s fit well enough to keep me from making a second trip to the store, but I will treat them like royalty in the laundry to keep them from stretching out and becoming too big. If you're between 2 sizes, try the smaller one.

I ordered these online in my normal TTS 4 because I was so excited about trying the everlux fabric. I wanted so badly to give these 5 stars! The pros about them are super soft, comfortable, amazing fit, looks great on, and they really do just feel like a second skin. I do a lot of HIIT training and strength training and the ease of movement in these pants is awesome. I have washed them and they washed up great as well. Yes, they pass the squat test and dead lift test. The one and ONLY con that I have found with these pants is they are not sweat proof! I sweat a ton when I work out ( even with luxtreme) and understand that I am using these pants for what they are intended for and that is working out, however, it still is embarrassing that even with black tights I had major crotch sweat when I was done! I feel the need to mention this because these pants are advertised as sweat wicking, and "dries so fast it's like magic." This was not the case for me and it is disappointing based on the fact that they are advertised for your "sweatiest workouts."

Wow, I start liking writing reviews for lulu.
I'm super picky and I was in doubt when I made the purchase online. As I super adore the waistline of Align Pant II (curved on the back and just one simple line) and I was not sure if the design of these pants will look as good as the Align Pant II (they make my booty looks so great that I don't even know that I have a booty like this).
Tried them on, all hesitation and doubt disappeared.
In the Movement will be my go-to tights for high intensity workout while Align Pant II for everything else.
Like another review said, it's Align meets high intensity.
You have to try them and you'll love them.
Just please realize more fun colors.

column5: Love the material and the design - new favorites!
column6: I bought these in store last week and have worn twice. Both times they were so comfortable and easy to wear. I didn't think about them at all during my workout (strength training). I thought they might feel hot because the material is a bit thick, but somehow they didn't at all. I got the nocturnal teal and I can see I'll probably end up with another color at some point as well. I also love the simple style - seaming to keep it a bit interesting, but no mesh or anything like that.

Got a pair in the color nocturnal teal in the mail today and have been wearing them for a few hours, testing them out. I've never tried align pants so I cannot compare these tights to them. These tights are buttery soft (but not too slick) at first touch and they are easy to pull on. I'd say they are true to size. To me, they seem like a slightly thinner version of full-on luxtreme but they are totally squat proof and ARE NOT see through, which I am so happy about. I wouldn't say they are as compressive as luxtreme or luon tights, but they're not useless, either. I can't wait to have a full sweaty session in these tights tomorrow!

These pants are super flattering. As soon as I put them on I fell inlove. Soft, flattering and full coverage. However, after an hour in these pants the material had picked up ever piece of lint, hair or crumb. They looked filthy and then began to pill after one wash. I love the fit and style of these pants, but the material could use some work.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey mollylu,\nSorry to hear that your In Movement 7/8 Tight isn't holding up as expected. Please feel free to give our GEC a call at 1.877.263.9300 to continue this conversation.", 'LL_response_date': 'September 24, 2017'}

column6: What is this fabric? Trying to compete with Athleta's power vita? Not there yet but close. Powervita is much thicker and stretchy. I really like these tights. If I could add one thing it would be side pockets and they would be the best tights ever. I got the aeon and they are slightly sheer because the fabric is quite thin. But I still love these tights!
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey urajiro,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.', 'LL_response_date': 'September 22, 2017'}

column6: I purchased a Black and Garnet pair of these and was really disappointed in the quality of the Garnet pair in particular. The material of the black In Movement tights felt like more durable aligns and fit well in my TTS but overall I wasn't crazy about the material. The material of garnet pair however felt HORRIBLE. They were scratchy and already had light pilling on them (I JUST got them from an online order, how did this happen??). I got a size 6 in both but for some reason the Garnet ones fit tighter in the legs and the waist was looser. They really felt like two completely different pants.
column19: {'LL_response_content': 'Hey DieselBlack,\nThanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.', 'LL_response_date': 'September 20, 2017'}

column6:
My very first lulus I picked from the store and I couldn't be happier! these are 100% squat proof > color black (I got tattoos on my cheeks, so covering them with such soft material is a miracle!), they feel like butter or feather or nothing at all, don't show sweat (I train intensively), very breathable and flattering. Band is perfect; don't have to pull them up and it doesn't cut in. Also no surprises after washing them. Getting more colors! No brainer...
I also bought align2 and they are awesome except they show sweat and definitely need to be babied during wash - inside out, started pilling but on the inside.
I like "in movement" more.
column19: {'LL_response_content': "Hey Truthrocks,\n\nWe strongly believe in creating gear that performs well for you and since this isn't the case, we sent you an email to chat about some options for your Align Pants II.", 'LL_response_date': 'September 20, 2017'}

column6: If I could describe these pants in one sentence, I would say that the material is Align meets high intensity. They feel just as buttery soft as the Align pant, but with all of the things that make them able to be used for running or HIIT workouts. The material is crazy soft and comfortable. I am 5'2" and 120 lbs and bought my usual size 4. As someone else mentioned, the waist band isn't as snug on these as on other pants. I wore them to an Orangetheory class this morning and did find myself having to pull them up a few times. With it being the first time I wore them, having to already adjust them as I'm wearing them makes me nervous. Additionally, there is no drawstring to keep them up. They will not fall down, but they are definitely not as snug as I would like them to be. I may go back and try a size 2 and if that works out better, I'm really hoping I'm able to exchange them. Large waistband aside, these pants are perfect for running and training. I hope they stick around!

Just wore these for the first time for two cycling classes this morning and they were ah-mazing! I felt way cooler in these than in my other lulu leggings and they absorbed sweat suuuper well. My only thing is the waistband runs a little larger on these. Didn't have to pull them up during class or anything, but I did notice they're not AS snug around my waist as other pants. For reference I'm a 4 and they fit pretty TTS.

I am between a 4-6 in most pants, and I got the 4 in these. I ran sprints for 30 mins in them the first time I wore them and did not have to pull them up or yank on them even once. they are super smooth and amazingly comfortable. Please lulu, bring some nice bright colours in them and I will buy more. Too man boring colours out right now.
